message: Hi, i created a "users" group. I know, i'm a bit silly, but i'm stress testing the product ;). SO, everything goes well, because the slug for the group was "users-1" ans was able to access it through: https://convore.com/users-1/ (pretty neat. How do you achieve that without a /groups/ before and allowing flatpages fallback?). The trouble comes when i edited the group in https://convore.com/users-1/edit/ and change the group URL to: https://convore.com/users/ of course, for the sake of testing ;). So, right now, my private group is holding this URL - which may be wrong - and i'm not able to edit the group url. https://convore.com/users/edit/ give me back a 404 page. Hope it helps.
FWIW, the group id should be 134. The page not found title is "'(134) Page not found"...
My bad. According to the API, the group id is 998.
